instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, turns on but powers off at login screenf
threads.message:
Have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with water damage on both sides of the board where the SMC is. Cleaned the corrosion and board powers on w/charger, but will restart after a few moments on the login screen and will not power on w/battery at all.

Before I start poking around at rails in the affected area, would this strange behaviour correspond to a specific rail or power distruption? Since the machine fully turns on and then fully turns off, how could I measure a faulty line? Unless the machine decides to turn itself off after x seconds of improper voltage on a certain line.
Anyway, glad to hear your thoughts!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, turns on but powers off at login screenf
threads.message:
First check what happens starting in SMC bypass mode.

"will not power on w/battery at all."
Doesn't turn on with battery alone and also battery plus charger?
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 at <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> exact voltage.

Possibly corroded resistors/traces, or bad solders around SMC.
